trans-unit.source: Replaces substrings in a string.

seg-source.mrk: Replaces substrings in a string.

target.mrk: Replaces substrings in a string.

trans-unit.source: Parameters

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: The string to evaluate.

seg-source.mrk: The string to evaluate.

target.mrk: The string to evaluate.

trans-unit.source: The substring to search for or the character position to start the replacement.

seg-source.mrk: The substring to search for or the character position to start the replacement.

target.mrk: The substring to search for or the character position to start the replacement.

trans-unit.source: The replacement string.

seg-source.mrk: The replacement string.

target.mrk: The replacement string.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The number of times to replace the searchstring. Use a negative occurrence to replace from the right side.

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
The number of times to replace the searchstring.
Use a negative occurrence to replace from the right side.

target.mrk: [optional]
The number of times to replace the searchstring.
Use a negative occurrence to replace from the right side.

trans-unit.source: 0 = all searchstrings will be replaced (default)

seg-source.mrk: 0 = all searchstrings will be replaced (default)

target.mrk: 0 = all searchstrings will be replaced (default)

trans-unit.source: [optional] Flag to indicate if the operations should be case sensitive.

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
Flag to indicate if the operations should be case sensitive.

target.mrk: [optional]
Flag to indicate if the operations should be case sensitive.

trans-unit.source: $STR_NOCASESENSE (0) = not case sensitive, using the user's locale (default)

seg-source.mrk: $STR_NOCASESENSE (0) = not case sensitive, using the user's locale (default)

target.mrk: $STR_NOCASESENSE (0) = not case sensitive, using the user's locale (default)

trans-unit.source: $STR_CASESENSE (1) = case sensitive

seg-source.mrk: $STR_CASESENSE (1) = case sensitive

target.mrk: $STR_CASESENSE (1) = case sensitive

trans-unit.source: $STR_NOCASESENSEBASIC (2) = not case sensitive, using a basic/faster comparison

seg-source.mrk: $STR_NOCASESENSEBASIC (2) = not case sensitive, using a basic/faster comparison

target.mrk: $STR_NOCASESENSEBASIC (2) = not case sensitive, using a basic/faster comparison

trans-unit.source: Returns the new string with the number of replacements performed stored in the @extended macro.

seg-source.mrk: Returns the new string with the number of replacements performed stored in the @extended macro.

target.mrk: Returns the new string with the number of replacements performed stored in the @extended macro.

trans-unit.source: Remarks

seg-source.mrk: Remarks

target.mrk: Remarks

trans-unit.source: By default or if the occurrence is positive the search/replace is performed left-to-right. Thus, StringReplace("aaa", "aa", "bb") returns "bba"

seg-source.mrk: By default or if the occurrence is positive the search/replace is performed left-to-right.
Thus, StringReplace("aaa", "aa", "bb") returns "bba"

target.mrk: By default or if the occurrence is positive the search/replace is performed left-to-right.
Thus, StringReplace("aaa", "aa", "bb") returns "bba"

trans-unit.source: If the start method is used the occurrence and casesense parameters are ignored. The function will replace the characters in "string", starting at the requested position, with the characters in "replacestring" - as many characters will be replaced as are in "replacestring". However, if there are not enough characters in "string" for the entire "replacestring" to be inserted an empty string is returned and @error is set to 1.

seg-source.mrk: If the start method is used the occurrence and casesense parameters are ignored.
The function will replace the characters in "string", starting at the requested position, with the characters in "replacestring" - as many characters will be replaced as are in "replacestring".
However, if there are not enough characters in "string" for the entire "replacestring" to be inserted an empty string is returned and @error is set to 1.

target.mrk: If the start method is used the occurrence and casesense parameters are ignored.
The function will replace the characters in "string", starting at the requested position, with the characters in "replacestring" - as many characters will be replaced as are in "replacestring".
However, if there are not enough characters in "string" for the entire "replacestring" to be inserted an empty string is returned and @error is set to 1.
